text: jubilation in India today after Narendra
Modi sweeps to power in India's general
elections the implications of the vote
today on the New York Times minute with
Modi in the incumbent Indian National
Congress is out they had dominated
Indian politics since independence and
Rahul Gandhi was their heir apparent no
longer flagging economic growth and
rampant corruption led Indian voters to
make this decisive move towards mr.
Modi's Hindu nationalist party the
elections come during a period of rapid
transition in Indian society
urbanization has changed voting patterns
across the country it appears that it
was mr. Modi's conservative ideology and
steely leadership style that endeared
him to voters 550 million votes were
cast during the five-week general
elections
and now much of the world's attention
will turn to mr. Modi himself he's only
the second regional leader to take the
Prime Minister seat and comes with his
own bit of controversy he's blamed by
many of India's Muslims for failing to
stop bloody religious riots a decade ago
but now in power he has big ambitions to
transform India into an economic power
on the level of nearby China but faces
difficult challenges as the new leader
of the world's largest democracy
Oh
